bibl.title: Letter from John R. and Ida E. Kissinger to Howard A. Kelly, [July 6, 1907]

div1.p: This is a typed copy of a correspondence from July 6, 1907, but includes a financial statement at the bottom of the letter not contained in the original autograph version.

div1.head: Letter from John R. and Ida E. Kissinger to Howard A. Kelly, [July 6, 1907]
div1.opener:
L
Dr. Howard A. Kelly,
Dear Sir and Kind Friend:
div1.p:
Yours received this A.M., and
words cannot tell how happy it makes us to receive the
amount you send us, we have worked so hard to keep things up.

Mr. Kissinger cried like a child when I handed him the
check, we certainly thank you and wish you to thank the other
kind friends for us that have taken the interest in us. This
morning not 20 minutes before the mail man called, I was
looking at your picture which we keep on our sittingroom
table, and I wondered why we had not heard from you, not for
the money's sake, but for friendship sake, because we both
feel that you have been a good kind friend to us. My circum-
stances have not always been quite so poor, but my parents
are both dead and have only strangers and acquaintances for
friends and advisers, but the Lord is my best Friend, I can
go to him when all others fail, oh, what a comfort. As Mr
Kissinger's health doesn't improve my kind friend Jennie Wilson
who is an invalid at South Whittley and through other
friends, have sent Mr. Kissinger a wheel chair, self-propelling
it hasn't come yet, but he watches for it anxiously. The
one he has I had to push by the back.

Wishing to thank you again, we will remain your
true friends and well wishers,
div1.closer:
Mr. & Mrs. John R. Kissinger. (We now have on hand $165.50, beside the check for $100
and a check which was drawn to Kissinger's own name for $5)
B.S.M.

div1.p:
feels so badly at times I think he will
not last long then he has such a will
Power he cant give up now Dear Dr
we have talked to a very Dear friend
and business man and he said he
would look up something for us and
do all he could for us and we
are certain he will for he has
been very much Intrested in our
well fare

I have Rheumatism in my hands my
joints are just as sore as can be having
them in the cold water so much we
would certainly be very glad to do
something else this winter and am
sure we will try faithfully for at
now to thank you and Other Intrested
friends for these and your kindness
and hoping this will meet with your
approval we beg to remain your
true friends and well wisher's
from Mr and Mrs John R Kissinger
606 E Keasey St
South Bend
Ind.
